website_summaries.verdict: Convenient Samsung smartwatch with a curved bracelet design. Clear and crisp AMOLED display and water-resistant design.
pros: Helps track fitness including steps, exercise, calories burned, heart rate, as well as sleep quality

customer_reviews.title: For fitness tracking, this is it
customer_reviews.text: It's a basic fitness tracker but accurate. It is not a smaller galaxy watch or anything like that. If you want to accurately track your workouts and that's all, this it it. If you want to store music, respond to texts, make phone calls? This ain't it. Spend the extra $100 on the watches. Also it works best with a Samsung phone not other android phones
customer_reviews.author: Dom6393

customer_reviews.title: This is a definite buy for Samsung fans.
customer_reviews.text: The fit is awesome! It works exactly as described and I'm loving all the features. Sometimes I leave my phone behind and this still gives me credit for those extra steps. The find my phone feature has already saved me once. The heart rate feature works flawlessly, I've had some problems with the models that were more geared towards being a watch but the fit is wonderful. I gave it 4 stars because they really need to make more watch faces or at least let you change the color schemes of the main screen options. Othert this is a buy you'll love.
customer_reviews.author: DangerWillRobinson

customer_reviews.title: for the Samsung fans
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a tracker that would do a "little more" and this one delivers. Syncs via Bluetooth to give you notifications for e-mails, phone calls, texts... The size is a plus, too - not so big and bulky like some of the smart watches. And at $99, you can't go wrong!
customer_reviews.author: trinity

customer_reviews.title: Hamstrung Device
customer_reviews.text: This could be so much more but the functionality and accuracy are pathetic. I have the original Samsung Gear and it can do more than this can! Please check out what options there are for watch faces very limited what info can be displayed also they can not be modified for colors or fonts. You are stuck with what you get. Tracking is way off too I typically get ~300 calories per 30 min of working out. With this I only got 100 in 30 min and I'm now dripping wet! Great battery life and comfortable but the clasp is weird but didn't give it time to get used to. DO NOT BUY!
customer_reviews.author: Cathy M. Stupplebeen

customer_reviews.title: Dissatisfied!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this Sept 26th and its Nov 1st and stopped working. Won't charge and my window for return closed. Kept disconnecting from my phone and would keep "ringing" even after I had ignored call. Very disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: tiffany t

customer_reviews.title: How many times can you return???
customer_reviews.text: The first galaxy fit I purchased died after 8 days and wouldn't recharge. The SECOND galaxy fit I ordered as a replacement stayed at 37% right out of the box and never charged. This device is a failure. Do not buy one, or two or three, or however many it would take to get one that actually works.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Vigil

customer_reviews.title: Exceeds expectations for the price, especially in the pool.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Price/design/functionality (notifications, clock, battery life). Great in the pool, automatically and accurately tracks lengths/laps (if you don't do flip turns) and strokes (somewhat accurately). Cons: Steps seem to reset after sleeping, whereas the app resets at midnight. Exercises done while disconnected from the phone don't seem to sync to the phone app once reconnected (have had to manually enter). Overall: Minor annoyances, but definitely still worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: BEM

customer_reviews.title: Frustrating
customer_reviews.text: Frustrating. Most functions simply did not work properly. Find a better fitness tracker.
customer_reviews.author: A. L.

customer_reviews.title: Not Good
customer_reviews.text: Got this as part of a package deal with a Samsung A50 phone. Love the phone but nothing but problems with this tracker. I had problems charging it and within 30 days of buying it, it died.
customer_reviews.author: OldArmyVeteran

customer_reviews.title: Best gift for call center workers.
customer_reviews.text: Love it! I'm not really a fitness buff or anything but it's good for me because I cant have my phone out on the floor at work. I havent missed 1 call or sms since I've started wearing this. I love the fact that it reminds me to get off my arse and move. I love the sleep tracker. And you can program the sms part with a bunch of different quick replies. Also ita is completely compliant with our clean desk policy at work by not being able to answer calls and reply to sms with anything other than the quick responses.
customer_reviews.author: tony hurlbut

customer_reviews.title: Great beginner's fitness tracker
customer_reviews.text: HR monitor is good, and the sleep and step trackers are relatively accurate. Syncing with the Health app is easy and helps track calories, sleep patterns and activities/workouts. You can decline calls, set quick responses for texts and dismiss/snooze your alarm. The inactivity alert is great for desk jobs and I probably charge it every 3 or 4 days with moderate use. It says water resistant but I still remove it before showering. Overall I'm very happy with this watch. Also, be careful with the charger. I looked for a backup to keep at work but there aren't any generic brands and the ONLY option I've found is $50.
customer_reviews.author: AGonzales7

customer_reviews.title: Great quality! It needs some improvements, maybe next gen !
customer_reviews.text: Nothing works like it should, but any other brand or product can do it. It works good enough. I stop using it like an every day watch because some times when you rise your wrist it didn’t turn on, I hate how automatically starts to track your “training” even when you’re doing nothing else than riding a scooter or walking. And it make me feel lazy when I’m not doing any exercise and vibrates and tell me “it’s time to move”! I’m just watching a movie! Leave me alone! But great quality, for real
customer_reviews.author: Santiago Agustin Palmero

customer_reviews.title: Breaks within 2 weeks.
customer_reviews.text: It was great for the first week and then the heart rate monitor and sleep tracking stopped working. I then tried updating to the latest software and you have to stay on the app and make sure your phone doesn’t turn off the screen otherwise the update would fail. Then I tried resetting it and now it won’t pair and just constantly vibrates alerting me that it’s trying to pair. I would rather spend 3x the price on an Apple Watch, at least it’ll work properly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Broken after 3 months
customer_reviews.text: I've had this fitness tracker for 3 months before it stopped charging. Samsung does not sell replacement chargers, so you are left to send it back to samsung for repair under warranty. What they dont tell you is you have to pay for the repairs. Now I have to pay $70 to get it fixed. It's a mediocre tracker at best, barely worth the $90 to buy, and certainly not worth another $70 to fix.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Why was it in Spanish!!!?!!!?!!!?!!!?!!!
customer_reviews.text: I got this watch to replace my old gear fit. When I ordered this the listing said NOTHING about spanish anywhere yet my watch was in a box with spanish writing on it and the watch itself was in Spanish. I can read write or speak any foreign language due to my disabilities. Needless to say I am not happy about having to navigate my new watch blind because inwas sent a product that has only a single language option. Sad to say I can not say much else atm about the item itself.
customer_reviews.author: BlackJaguar7

customer_reviews.title: Conectivity Issues
customer_reviews.text: I love the look and style of this watch. It is small and classy looking but does not connect to my Samsung Galaxy J7 phone. Went on line to trouble shoot why it doesn't connect using the Samsung Galaxy Wearable app only to find most of the info is in a foreign language. Even the user manual isn't in English, did find the manual on line but even after deleting the app, pairing the watch again and downloading the app again, the watch will not connect.
customer_reviews.author: Suzeyque

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: Had it 45 days. Does not wake up on motion when I turn my wrist. Talked Samsung support went through all steps like resetting it, reinstalling wearable app. Didn't work still, they had me do warranty repair which I submitted along with proof of purchase from Amazon app screenshot. They denied the warranty request even though I did exactly like they asked. Do not buy from Samsung they are scam artists.
customer_reviews.author: Travis B Klein

customer_reviews.title: Very very well made
customer_reviews.text: Was very torn between this and the Fitbit Inspire HR. Weighed pros and cons and went with this. So far I really like it. Very sophisticated app and features. I also strongly predict Samsung will continue to add more and more features via updates to sweeten the deal, they always do that on their phones. Will update in a few months. Very light, solidly built, and the companion app is very very useful. It's all about calories in vs calories out anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Jasmine

customer_reviews.title: Great device, but exists huge problems.
customer_reviews.text: This product is very nice and great! But the bluetooth of this device works like only near 3 meters or even less, so whenever i go little bit far, it is disconnecting from my phone . This is really horrible experience compared to my honor band 4, whhich was like even having 20 meters distance, phone calls and messages were coming. And also, as i am a IOS user, so for me it was so bad to notice that i am not able to quick response to any message came to my phone... This is smth, that is really not good. That’s it.
customer_reviews.author: Arsen

customer_reviews.title: Its decent
customer_reviews.text: The watch comes uncharged so you must charge the watch and it takes A WHILE for it to fully charge. It says that the battery life lasts a week, but mine has only lasted about 2 full days until I have to charge it again. The watch does disconnect at times, but not too much to be bothersome. Overall, after testing it out for a week it is a good watch for the price if you're looking for something simple. The only cons are the battery life and how it disconnects at times.
customer_reviews.author: sheela velasco

customer_reviews.title: Takes a long time to charge; Battery doesn't last more than 2 days
customer_reviews.text: USB charging so it may be partially to blame, but that's what was included. I plugged the band in at 9am with 37% left of it's charge; at 12:30 it's still only at 92% charged. A full charge will last about a day and a half if I'm tracking a LOT of walking/biking, but about 2 days if I sit on my butt. It does do as it's supposed to and track my activity, heart rate, sleep, etc, and provides realtime feedback on it so it does do what it's designed, the battery just isn't as robust as I'd like.
customer_reviews.author: Yeah, Me

customer_reviews.title: Device died after one week and poor support
customer_reviews.text: The device worked up until the point the battery had fully drained. Placed the device on its charger for more than an hour and it would still not turn back on. I contacted support and sent them the device. They were unable to fix the issue and said they would issue a refund. It has now been more than three weeks and no refund, no device, and non responsive support. If you have issues and you can return it to amazon I would do that. I am not at all happy with samsung support or this device.
customer_reviews.author: propenguin

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the money.
customer_reviews.text: After my wife got a fitbit I wanted to get onboard the fitness tracking watch bandwagon. I bought this watch to go with my Samsung phone. She was instantly jealous because it is so much nicer than her fitbit that cost just as much. The only downside for me is that it only comes with one wristband. I'm a big guy and the wristband that it came with is very tight on the largest setting.
customer_reviews.author: M. Baker

customer_reviews.title: Great for tracking...
customer_reviews.text: It helps me track my steps, sleep, heart rate and more. There are times where it disconnects from my phone, when it is only across the room. This tends to happen more often when there is an update available, either for the watch or the phone app. I have really enjoyed having this watch. I have even bought them for my parents.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney DeLong

customer_reviews.title: It Works!
customer_reviews.text: At first the band seemed difficult to adjust to, now its seems so simple! Not an app user so that too scared me a little but my husband and I set it up easily! After being put in the hospital with A Fib having this sweet little watch on my wrist gives me much peace of mind just by looking at my bpm's.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Z

customer_reviews.title: Goes well with S9.
customer_reviews.text: I got this to see if I would even wear a watch. So far I really like it. It does as advertised and goes great with my S9. The only downside is that it's a little tricky to put on. I'm sure there's a trick to it, but as of now I just keep pulling out arm hair.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Barker

customer_reviews.title: Decent watch
customer_reviews.text: The battery life is not nearly as good as the Fitbit. I have to recharge it every 3 or 4 days. Takes over an hour. Other than that it works great . profile is a little higher than the Fitbit as well but it does talk to my map my ride which is one of the reasons I did not like the Fitbit! What's the point of having a heart monitor if it won't talk to you workout app
customer_reviews.author: titanium cycler

customer_reviews.title: Great battery Life!
customer_reviews.text: I really like the batter life. My old fitness watches only lasted a couple of days on one charge. The Galaxy Fit lasted me about 2 weeks on the same usage rate. There's no fancy watch faces, but works as advertised if that's not what you're mainly looking for. Connectivity works well. I can definitely push the typical 30ft Bluetooth range before disconnection. The band is comfortable and stays on even through some pickup basketball games, which my old watches would always fall off. I'm pretty pleased with this watch.
customer_reviews.author: John Do

customer_reviews.title: Great watch in a small package
customer_reviews.text: Had some issues getting the app to work on a Pixel 4 at forst but some update took care of it. Battery life has been solid lasting around 4 days between charges with vibration on for notifications. Screen size is decent for reading messages and the menus are easy to interact with.
customer_reviews.author: Jonah Salerno

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the cost
customer_reviews.text: Nice device for the price. Easy to setup and sync to Samsung phones. Switching between screens is a little choppy but for the basic functions you would need to perform, it is more than ready. I have two of them and would recommend anyone to get this if you need a simple fitness tracker.
customer_reviews.author: Devo

customer_reviews.title: Think before you buy.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bracelet and used it for 5 days. Sleep tests are sometimes unsuccessful. There are some differences in software between iOS and Android. Android is better than iOS, but I am an iOS user. Battery life is ok, since I last charged it, I still have 23% left. But in general, I still don't recommend everyone to buy, because the experience is very average. Especially the buckle is really too bad.
customer_reviews.author: Junjie Z.

customer_reviews.title: Waste of time, literally..
customer_reviews.text: Waste of time, connects via Bluetooth to iOS device, however, will not connect to the iOS wearable app.. called Samsung support, was asked to call Apple for help.. so much for customer support from Samsung.. Plan to return the device Also, the band is made of real cheap plastic.. really uncomfortable to wear..
customer_reviews.author: AD

customer_reviews.title: Almost Good
customer_reviews.text: Great features, rugged design, it seemed like a great smart watch at first. The Bluetooth range is a deal breaker though. The Bluetooth range seems to be, what? 10 inches? Constantly makes my phone go "Bing!" with an alert message. Check for messages, nope, no message, it's just the watch losing connection again. This goes on all day. I can't recommend this watch at all.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Cherry

customer_reviews.title: Band is horrible
customer_reviews.text: I walk miles every day at work and steps contribute to our insurance discount. Neither the watch or band come into contact with anything throughout the day but my band broke a few days ago. I'm honestly surprised it lasted this long though. It's a very thin and cheap feeling band. It's not handy at all to put on, either.
customer_reviews.author: Josh Keller

customer_reviews.title: Almost lasted a year
customer_reviews.text: Great battery life. Works great when it works. HR seems accurate. Touch screen isn't great. Takes multiple swipes to register. Makes controlling music and initiating workouts a pain. Tried the sleep tracker twice and it only tracked the first time. The screen went completely white today, after 11 months. It's still under warranty but not going through the hassle to get it serviced. The best use for me was tracking HR during workouts.
customer_reviews.author: LatinKraze

customer_reviews.title: Most comfortable fitness device, kind of short battery life
customer_reviews.text: I love this for its comfort - I forget I'm wearing it - and for the easy to use features. Paired instantly with my samsung phone and never gets confused like my fitbit did. The battery lasts 4 days, not 7 as promised, possibly because I have constant heart rate and stress monitoring turned on.
customer_reviews.author: Maggie D.

customer_reviews.title: Loving my Samsong Fit
customer_reviews.text: Great bargain. The app came with my phone.I didn't even know Samsong sold watches. This watch/tracker is perfect for me. Loving it! Added bonus was the choice from over ten face options. Also enjoy the do not disturb feature that syncs with my phone. No light flicking on everytime I move my wrist while sleeping. Band clasp is pretty neat too, once I figured out the tab tucks under the band.
customer_reviews.author: D. R. B. Hough

customer_reviews.title: Better then expected and worth the $$
customer_reviews.text: Great for the money and 10x the quality of a Fitbit tracker. Have tried lots of the smart watches. Fitbit apple watch and some chinese knock offs. This one has the touch screen, compact size and super performance all in one and way cheaper then a fitbit.
customer_reviews.author: Eduardo

customer_reviews.title: Poor battery life
customer_reviews.text: Says batter will last 7 days. (Per Samsung, not this seller) With heart rate monitor set to only once every 10 minutes instead of continuous I am lucky to get 3 days. Maybe if turn heart rate monitor off and leave on your dresser you can get 7 days but then why buy it. I have not tried and would like on continuous monitoring but I suspect it will have to be charged daily then.
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: Great for my fitness needs.
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I wanted. Bluetooth tethering to phone is about normal range so it does disconnect time to time but it doesn't effect the primary functions of the watch. I don't use it in water or sleep with it just because that's my own preference not to. The auto workout mode is awesome as well.
customer_reviews.author: Shelly S.

customer_reviews.title: Great smart watch.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great smart watch with about a 6-day charge. I was hospitalized for 6-Days and the watch lasted until I got home to recharge it. The data BPM is reliable and this is something worth having.
customer_reviews.author: Manuel Labor

customer_reviews.title: Love this tracker!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to keep track of oxygen, pulse, sleep and activity. It's great at all of these. Very pleased with this activity tracker.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia Richardson

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Watch!!
customer_reviews.text: Just got a new Samsung phone and decided to buy the fit. The watch works amazing, it constantly shows my heart rate and the steps i've taken today. And while i don't really care, it even shows calories burned!! The battery lasts super long, only using around 17% a day (keep in mind a full charge is achieved after 3 hours). The screen colors are amazing and you can customize the each page of the watch. AMAZING PRODUCT! only problem being that the actual size of the screen might be a tad bit underwhelming, it's slightly smaller than expected but nevertheless amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Diegs N.

customer_reviews.title: It stopped tracking steps and heart rate after 7 months
customer_reviews.text: It started out fine, but stop tracking steps and heart rate after 7 months of use. It started acting up around 6 months. First started not tracking steps accurately on routine walks. Then started locking up. Then would die with full charge and would not restart. Putting it on the charger would turn it back on after a day or two. Charges would last 3-4 days when working normally. The band design wasn't comfortable as it tends to rub red and irrate wrist skin during physical activities.
customer_reviews.author: M. Tatsuno

customer_reviews.title: Always 1 thousand steps less than my phone step meter.
customer_reviews.text: When I push a grocery cart, it doesn't record any steps. In fact it is consistantly 1-2 thousand steps lower than my Samsung 8+ Swipe screen very frustrating. Short battery life
customer_reviews.author: Woods

customer_reviews.title: Samsung Galaxy bit watch
customer_reviews.text: I really liked this watch. After receiving mine I purchased my wife one. The battery life continue to dwell down to where I had to charge it daily. This did not suit me. If they would correct this problem I would buy one for my whole family
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Wright

customer_reviews.title: better than a smart watch
customer_reviews.text: so much better than a smartwatch because I can charge it for 20 min while I shower and get ready for work and it will last a week!
customer_reviews.author: mike solito

customer_reviews.title: Used for running
customer_reviews.text: I got this to track my runs and workouts. The auto turn-on by rotating your wrist, so it kept lighting up when I shifted in bed. The battery life has alot to be desired. I work out/run twice a week and the battery would only last 3 days. I turned off the auto on and now it lasts about 4 days. But very comfortable, I sometimes forget it's there. I haven't tried it in water, might try it this summer. I like that it takes accurate heart rate though I wear it on the inside of my wrist. Great for running, not the best for the gym.
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie Imker

customer_reviews.title: I wish I didn't take so long to try it after I bought it.
customer_reviews.text: I own an iPhone XR. When I call someone the watch starts vibrating and displays the name of the person I am talking to. Why would that be considered a feature that anyone would need. I would return it if I could.
customer_reviews.author: Hank Kimball's... I can't remember.

customer_reviews.title: Great fitness tracking watch
customer_reviews.text: I love it. It works well with my Samsung Galaxy s9 and keeps me on track with my exercise schedule. I love the "get moving" reminders and the fact that it tracks your stress level and sleep, water intake and more..
customer_reviews.author: Debra A. Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Great fit bit
customer_reviews.text: Paired up to my Samsung A50 perfectly; great addition to my morning work outs. Love it. You go buy it!
customer_reviews.author: Scoöter Buell

customer_reviews.title: Returned after 2 days
customer_reviews.text: I had to return the Galaxy Fit because the main screen always said "get started in the Galaxy Wearable app...". Although i had it set up and it was connected to my phone I could never get it to go to the main face page that would show time and tracking info. I called Samsung support and the guy said take it to a service center (cant because of Mr Covid) or return it. I'm returning it. I could not really get the sleep to work the one night I had it.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Charles

customer_reviews.title: Can't see in sunlight
customer_reviews.text: I just returned this watch. I could not read it outside which didn't help when trying to see steps and heart rate. Only flaw, but it was major for me. Nice watch, comfortable to wear and thought it was accurate.
customer_reviews.author: Amiga

customer_reviews.title: Not equal or better than gear line
customer_reviews.text: my gear fit 2 was more versatile and lasted longer. Long time Samsung fan but this isn't my favorite watch. I'm debating an upgrade, even though I hate round watches.
customer_reviews.author: aja fillers

customer_reviews.title: very awkward wristband to put on or remove
customer_reviews.text: I bought this thinking that it would fit my small wrist. Somewhere I saw a description that it would fit down to 5.1" wrist, I measured my wrist at 5.25", and the band is a little big. It would probably be ok, but it is such a struggle to put the band on and to remove it, because of the design of the buckle and strap. I know I would get frustrated with this. I never even turned the watch on to try out any features. I am returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Slow charging. Value for money. Accurate heart rate, sleep and activity tracking
customer_reviews.text: Very good product for the price. However, I am not happy about the battery life on this. Under full use, it lasts about 3-4 days. Charging is very slow. Activity tracking is very good. The interface is super intuitive. Heart rate and sleep monitoring are also accurate. It is a little convenient to switch between two apps, Wearable and Samsung Health.
customer_reviews.author: Saurabh Kadam

customer_reviews.title: Great for Beginnners
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my Son who is just starting his fitness journey! It is a great device and worth the money! The app is very user friendly and allows us to pair and challenge each other!
customer_reviews.author: Karen Baca

customer_reviews.title: Tough.
customer_reviews.text: It works, I've banged this thing everywhere and it still hasn't cracked. Battery life is long too. This perfectly suits my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Raul

customer_reviews.title: Great fitness tracker watch.
customer_reviews.text: This works great with my Samsung Note 9. I wish the battery life lasted a bit longer. However, it's worth it. The notifications can easily be read, it tracks my steps with precision and smaller on my wrist.
customer_reviews.author: Roxanne Hill

customer_reviews.title: Daughter loves the Fit
customer_reviews.text: Eldest daughter really loves it for working out. She has a full-sized Fossil, but it's too big and too 'fancy' for exercise or work (hospital). This 'Fits' the bill perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: J. Carson

customer_reviews.title: Glad I bought it!!
customer_reviews.text: I have replaced the band but the watch is awesome for seeing your texts and responding with pre typed messages that you can customize in the app. It tracks sleep and workout really well and tells me when I reach my step target each day! I cant go a day without wearing it!
customer_reviews.author: Mariah Maurer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome tracking watch
customer_reviews.text: I recommend it for any one who love android system. About battery life i turn off when i didn't use (that helps people who care about battery life). I which if they add more watch faces that we can choose between them.
customer_reviews.author: Yasser Ahmed

customer_reviews.title: Basic fitness band, just what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable, screen is good size, has just enough functionality for me, nothing fancy. Syncs with my cell phone well. Happy with it, but deducting one star because the battery runs down more quickly than advertised.
customer_reviews.author: ResearchGoddess

customer_reviews.title: Sync stinker
customer_reviews.text: Don't waste your money on this tracker. The watch works great but doesn't sync properly so the app only tracks a fraction of the steps! Tech support is very limited and can't explain why this happens, they keep telling me to unpair and repair the Bluetooth, uninstall and reinstall the app to no avail. The mystery of the missing steps remains!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: LIES!! Cheaply Made! "military-grade durability" is such bogus. Do not buy!
customer_reviews.text: So frustrated with this product. Screen cracked in less than 3 months of owning it, but I did not hit it,or drop it, or even so much as scrape this fragile little watch. "Military-grade durability" is the biggest lie, I am surprised it is not classified as false advertising. Of course their customer service is garbage, and they were gonna make me pay for repairs, even though I already paid extra for the warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Better than the charge 4
customer_reviews.text: This is way better than the fitbit charge 4. It's smaller, but the functions are more user friendly.
customer_reviews.author: Hardwood-Mac

customer_reviews.title: Ok but galaxy active probably a better choice
customer_reviews.text: Have only really ised sleep tracking but it seems intermittent and there are times it claims im sleeping when im watching videos on my tablet or phone. Also not sure what the band is made of but it has given me a rash where the band sits and i have never had an issue with watch/fitness bamds in the past.
customer_reviews.author: p_lo

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Fast shipping, reasonable price, I bought 3 of them for my kids, easy to use, great product. Kids are happy with them.
customer_reviews.author: stacey

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for an active watch!
customer_reviews.text: If you just want to keep track of your heart rate, sleep, stress, and workouts this is perfect. I have a samsung phone and it is really easy to use, battery lasts for days after charged, it is light and looks good on you. Not ideal for looking at notifications and the screen is small, but I only wanted the active part of a smart watch and it is perfect in that aspect.
customer_reviews.author: JJLemus

customer_reviews.title: Not what I was expecting at no fault of its own
customer_reviews.text: It does what it should but I question it's accuracy. I had a fitbit that I wore on a belt. It counted steps in the grocery store when you're pushing a cart. The wrist counter doesn't count because your hands are on the cart. Then I've been doing some home improvement (tiling backsplash) and it counted all that movement as steps.
customer_reviews.author: From Michigan

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and does a lot
customer_reviews.text: I got this as a Christmas gift for my husband, it was his first smart watch. He really loved it and the simplicity of it. I use past tense because he recently upgraded to the Samsung Gear Fit2 Pro (which he loves even more) but as far as a starter smart watch goes, this one is great. product_meta.title: Samsung Galaxy Fit Black (Bluetooth), SM-R370NZKAXAR – US Version with Warranty
product_meta.description: Look and feel your best with the lightweight yet durable Samsung Galaxy Fit.1 Easily track your fitness and wellness, day and night, in clear, vivid color. A simple glance at your wrist lets you monitor workouts, heart rate and sleep. And keep an eye on notifications from a comfortable, stylish fitness tracker that lasts up to a week on a single charge.
feature_bullets: Automatic Fitness Tracking: Walk, run, cycle, even hop on the elliptical—the Galaxy Fit automatically detects and tracks what you’re doing.
Full Color Amoled Display: The always-on, full-color display gives you real-time info at a glance. Touch or swipe to scroll between workouts and notifications.
Made with a swim-ready design and military-grade durability to protect it against bumps, dust, extreme heat and bitter cold. Case Dimension (H x W)- 45.1 x 18.3 millimeter
Wellness Monitoring: Tracks daily steps, calories burned, water/caffeine intake and more. Monitors sleep patterns, and sends real-time alerts if detecting an irregularly high heart rate.
Compatible Devices - Samsung Smartphone, Non-Samsung Android Smartphone(Android OS 5.0 and above, RAM 1.5 GB and above), iOS 10.0 and above, iPhone 7 and above

Notification & Quick Reply: You’re always connected, so you’ll be notified of incoming calls or texts right on your Galaxy Fit. Plus, send quick, preset replies, and keep an eye on schedules, the forecast and more.
